comment._content: Oh my, I forgot all about this. It's bringing back memories to look at these photos. We'd lived in Richmond only 2 years at the time.

comment.author: 95788217@N02
comment._content:
When I was a boy of six years old I fondly remember the noise this bridge made when we drove our car across it. It had steel plates running its entire length which your tires rode on. It made a loud singing sound as the weight  of car tires pressed against each one it passed and made this continuing sound until you reached the other side.
  Also When I heard they were going to tear it down, I asked my dad if he could acquire a section and bring it to our back yard in Bon Air. He did not forget and had to tell all his friends at  Hankins and Anderson.       Barry E. Hewitson
